Dear Ms. Lanning:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 2/12/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12712 Supervision.
(1) An agency shall provide post-placement supervisory
visits for the adoptive family at the adoptive parent's
home as needed to assure the safety and well being
of the child, but not less than once every month, after
the placement of a child and until the final order of
adoption.
Two of two files reviewed of families with post-placement adoption supervision
requirements did not contain documentation of all of the required monthly visits.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was provided regarding obtaining copies of adoption
finalization orders as one file reviewed did not contain this information making it
impossible to determine when post-placement visit requirements ended.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was provided regarding the need to continue to utilize the licensing rule
book for agency compliance as the director was informed by another agency director
that the rule book was no longer applicable and to use the Public Act 116 book
solely.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
There have been no changes to the policies or requirements of the agency during
the period under review. The staff interviewed did not report any concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
